title: Welcome to the Seminar Preparation!
text:
Description
Welcome to my seminar preparation resources! This website hosts a collection of short courses covering various topics that will help you prepare for your seminar thesis. If you are interested in large language models, or geographical data analysis, these materials are designed to you. Each course is self-contained and provides you with the fundamental knowledge and practical skills needed for your research project.


Learning Outcomes
My goal is to introduce you to some basics and tools that will help you in your seminar thesis.
Upon completing the sections, you willâ€¦

know how to work with geographical data and GIS tools
understand how to interact with and utilize large language models

Please note that these topics are specifically designed for beginners. No prior programming experience is required although it is helpful. The format accommodates different skill levels to ensure everyone can follow along and learn effectively.


Blocks
The content of the course is currently organized in three blocks:

Part I: Geographical Data Analysis
Part II: Large Language Models



Structure
The resources are mostly available on this website and some are also available as interactive Jupyter notebooks, which you can download and run locally on your computer. I will try to update the website as often as possible, to extend the content and reflect the latest developments in the field.


How to see the slides

This course is based on Quarto
It uses revealjs to render the slides
You find the slides for each lecture in the corresponding lecture
To see the slides, click on RevealJS in the top right side in the lecture
You can also just scroll on the website to see all content without the slide styling



Questions
If you have any questions, please contact me under tobias.vlcek@uni-hamburg.de.
